data.text: 24 hours later: Still no sign of the intense side effects I was warned to expect after dose 2 of #Pfizer. Arm's a bit stiff and sore, but other than that, no major effects other than a HUGE sense of relief.
@segacs So happy for you on your way to be fully protected and protect loved ones around you! Special congrats for not letting your fear gets in the way to do the right for you and community 💪💪
@segacs That’s amazing! Not only did I have to remove mine but the lady hesitated to give me a second mask.
@ninjabaker42 Haha, thanks. It never really gets conquered. But it also won't stand in the way of getting vaccinated to protect those I care about.
@segacs Fully vaccinated and conquering you needle phobia! Yay!  Congratulations!

I should add: There was basically no wait, and I was in and out in <25 minutes, including the 15 minute wait time. 

There are plenty of appointments now on Clic Sante, and an abundance of doses at walk-in clinics of both Moderna and Pfizer. If you haven't already, #GetYourVax.

Also: While I was a bit disappointed at the lack of ventilation and the use of flimsy surgical masks at the CLSC, they *did* let me keep my N95 on underneath without argument. So that's good, at least.

I wish the security guard wasn't wearing his mask under his nose, though.

Because no vaccine is perfect and my partner is #HighRiskCOVID, I'll continue to #MaskUp and self-isolate even after I'm 14 days post-dose 2. 

But I'm relieved and glad to be doing my part to both protect him, and to reduce the spread of #COVID19 in #Quebec. #VaccinesWork.
